title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
I have an 820-2530 which is not turning on. I have 0.19 volts on ppbus with no short.

The adapter light turns green and never changes to orange, does that indicate anything in particular?

My only thought is isl6958, but I am not sure what enables I should be checking first

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Post some voltages for ISL6258 (U7000), pins 2, 3, 19, 20, 12, 1, 14, 9, 15.
Post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
thanks :-)

of the 9 voltages you asked for I have 0v on all of them except 3.4v on pin 12 and 18.2v on pin 1

17/18 20.7 ohms
27/28 20.4 ohms

on a side not the steady green light is gone

edit added/

I do have a 10 ohm short on r7011  or pins 3 and 19 or the isl

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Looks like bad U7000; remove C7044 to confirm.

Do you have short/low value on other pins of U7000?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
of the 9 voltages (2, 3, 19, 20, 12, 1, 14, 9, 15) you asked for I have 0v on all of them except 3.4v on pin 12 and 18.2v on pin 1

is this what you are asking?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
NO.
I asked for short, or low resistance to ground.
So chek in diode mode these pins...

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: I did switch the isl, and the short is gone between pins 3 and 19. The only voltage change is I now have 4.35v at pin 3. I still have the same voltages at 12 and 1. Do you still need me to check for shorts/lows on the other isl pins?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: I bet D7010 is burnt; confirm and change it...

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: thanks. I will try that tomorrow. Does that diode change the voltage or just work as a one-way valve?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Just a protection for U7000.
Voltage drop on it is less than 0.5V...

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Well, this was interesting. I switched out the diode and had a good ppbus of 12.6v. I think I still had other issues as it was not pulling hardly any amps. I was wondering about the missing green light on the charger and noticed one of the power pins was pushed in. So I grabbed an after marker charger which we have used for ages(we have gotten rid of all of them, expect this one was still laying around) to see if I would get the green light back, which I did. Then I was taking voltages for all of the isl6258 pins for future reference. Then I noticed it was no longer working anymore. D7010 is bad again. While measuring it I noticed the after marker charger is giving 18.9 volts, could this have been what caused it or just coincidence? I am leaning towards coincidence since something had to have killed D7010 before and it is likely the same thing. Should I track another diode down and try again?

edit added//
for replacement diodes, what things should I be looking for in the schematics so I can check donor boards?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
After D7010 is changed, don't power up the board before check for short or low value to ground on some pins of U7000; especially pin 2!!!
That diode is not critical; original is Schottky, but normal Si should work too.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: is SI mean a silicone diode? Is the difference having a slightly greater voltage drop? Could you give any suggestions on what to search for in the schematic in regards to finding a replacement?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
1SS418, is not a critical diode
Silicon Epitaxial Schottky Barrier Type, 30V/100mA.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: what do you mean it is not critical? Do you mean a different type of diode with a 100ma limit can be used or I can just use a jumper(probably not).

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Any diode should work there; not dificult to find one.
It should work with jumper too.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: I did put a big fat diode on there. Pin 2 is not shorted. I have a short on pin 17.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
So you have a short on PPBUS_G3H.
Remove F7000 and see which side the short remains.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: I am embarrassed. I am not sure what I did, but 17 is not shorted :-( Sorry. I think I may have read M(ohm) as plain ohms

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: OK, post then voltage at mentioned pins of U7000; after D7010 was changed.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: I do have a good ppbus of 12.61. I did before for a few minutes last time, but it did not last and d7010 burned out.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
So D7010 is burnt again???
Really strange, as you got correct PPBUS_G3H.
Change C7010 too...

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: I am sorry for being unclear. My oversized D7010 is still good and I still have a good ppbus. I was trying to say, whatever caused d7010 to burn out twice, will it happen a third time? What has changed?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
D7010 was burnt because of U7000, pretty sure.
Change C7010 just in case...

Is the board working now?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: now I lost ppbus, or it is .4 volts :-(  This time d7010 is still good. I wonder if I shorted something on u7000 by checking voltages on some of the other pins(just curious). I will get more info later for you. Thanks for all of the help.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
I now have 22.5 ohm between 17 and 18 and still have 20.4 ohm between 27 and 28. May I ask what you were checking for when you asked for these?

these are the new voltages on the isl pins:
2   18.5v
3   4.4v
19   0.2v
20   0.2v
12   3.4v 
1   18.6v
14,9,15   all have 0v

I also have short on 19 and 20, is that the issue?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
"19 0.2v
20 0.2v
------------
I also have short on 19 and 20, is that the issue?"
For sure...
If both pins have short to ground, bad ISL6259.
When remove it, check for any short to ground before solder another one.
Change R7040, probably burnt now.

"now have 22.5 ohm between 17 and 18 and still have 20.4 ohm between 27 and 28"
All correct there.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
after pulling off the ISL, the only shorts are 6 and 22, but I think they are both grounds and normal. I am hesitant to put another one on as something is frying it. The board came to me with a bad d7010. I replaced it and I had ppbus for a few minutes then d7010 fried again. I then replaced that diode with a stronger(I am assuming) one, then my ISL fried. I am guessing whatever was frying the d7010 was what fried the ISL since this time the d7010 did not act as a fuse.

I do have the original ISL I pulled. I suspect it may have been good, since d7010 probably protected it. Before I put it back on, what might be damaging the circuit?

this is an isl 6258, I noticed Rossman does not sell this one and I am out of new donors

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Is true, that is ISL6258.
D7010 gets burnt because of U7000, not viceversa.

"2 18.5v"
A bit higher the input voltage.
Are you using bench power supply, or fake chinese charger?
16V should be normal voltage for original 60W charger.
However, original 85W charger shouldn't burn anything...

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: It is a cheap one I have used for years. I will throw it away. I have only been buying genuine ones since I started following Rossman videos. Assuming the charger is not what fried it, could other things be doing it?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
If you get correct voltage at F7000, shouldn't have other reason.
However, check Q7020 and C7025.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
I am still waiting on my ISLs to ship. Just curious, my oversized replacement for d7010 only drops 4/100ths of a volt, 18.50 to 18.46, is that normal? I was expecting more like 4/10ths of a volt drop. Could this cause any issues?

also will any ISL6258AHRTZ work? I see some have a second group of letters besides this main listing

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
I replaced both d7010 and u7000 and I do now have a good ppbus of 12.6. For what it is worth, the charger always stays green and does not go to orange.

I do not have any voltage on pm_slp_s4

I was looking at u7750 and some stuff does not seem right. I would expect 1volt on both pins 2 and 3, but I have 3.4 volts on both, is that suspect? I have only .8 volts on pin 6.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Wrong assumptions.
Do you get 1.05V at C7771?
If not, change that cap...

PM_SLP_S4_L should go high when press power button.

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: why would I not assume based on the names P[B]1V05[/B]_S5_EN would be 1.05 volts and P[B]1V05[/B]_S5_PGOOD is also 1.05 volts? I am asking to try and learn and understand

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 46829"]

PM_SLP_S4_L should go high when press power button.[/QUOTE]

when I start it by attaching the magsafe it is not pulsing.

I think I have checked all of my s5 rails, but this older board seems different than I am used to and it does not seem to have many listed in the schematic

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
MCP platforms never start when charger is plugged in; another wrong assumption.
Only iCore boards start this way.

"why would I not assume based on the names"
Just for that; pay atention to ENTIRE name.
EN and PGOOD mean something; they are signals, not power rails...

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Thanks for taking the time to explain these things. I did know they were signals, but I see my mistake. The name was referring to the power rail it started, not the voltage of the signal.

I attached a wire to pin5 of the keyboard connector and tapped the other side to ground to mimic pressing the button, [B]but I am not getting any pulse on pm_slp_s4[/B]. Was that a correct way of starting the system?

Could I also short smc_onoff_l to start it?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Solder a wire on SMC_ONOFF_L line and touch the ground (momentary).

"Do you get 1.05V at C7771?
If not, change that cap..."
Can we get a reply?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
we do have 1.05v at c7771. I was looking for a clock chip and realized that is part of the MCPs job. I did check for a frequency at rtc_clk32k_xtalin and out and I get an erratic reading between 31 and 36mhz (jumping) 

I am not getting any pulse on pm_slp_l when touching smc_onoff_l to ground

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Post resistance to ground (ohm scale) at 3V42 power rail.
You must get more than 30K...

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: Yeah agreed less than 30Kohms this junk

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: I will test this later. Why are we checking for less than 30k on pp3v42 ? What does that indicate? I am guessing bad mcp, if so why?

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: Yes, lower value denotes bad MCP...

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message:
Thanks 2informaticos for your patience and help :-)

on a side note,any idea what would damage the MCP?

(I have not yet verified thst is the problem, but that uneven frequency seems bad)

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: Its age is a good reason to get bad...

title: 820-2530 ppbus .19 volts always stays green
message: It is official, it is dead: 23k ohm.
